Description: Pottery: base of red slipped cup or bowl. In the centre, a foot-shaped stamp, ATT - Att(i)?; On the under side is incised Έρματος.
Curator's comments: Names, Ermas and Atti(us) Roman Pottery Naukratis II., pl. 22, No. 862. For Atti, cf. C.I.L., xi. 6700, 116 (an Arretine potter). Gardner in Naukratis II., pl. 22, No. 862 reads Έρμία(ι)ος.
Bibliographic references: Roman Pottery / Catalogue of the Roman Pottery in the British Museum (L43)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IF.002)
